Package app.repository

Class dbExec

java.lang.Object
app.repository.dbExec
public class dbExec extends Object
This class is used to make requests to the database and send results back to the front-end to show the results.

    • getMenuItems

      public static ArrayList<javafx.util.Pair<Item,String>> getMenuItems()
      This gets all of the menu items and pairs up an Item object referring that menu item and a string for its description. Note that the Item's orderID will not be initialized because this is just to get all menu items on the restaurant's catalog
      Returns:
      an arraylist of pairs, where key = menu item of type Item and value = description

    • getAllIngredients

      public static HashMap<String,Ingredient> getAllIngredients()
      This gets all of the ingredients in the inventory table in the database
      Returns:
      HashMap with key = ingredient name and value = Ingredient object

      Parameters:

      Parameters:

      Parameters:
      itemName - menu item to look for
      Returns:

    • getAllOrderIDsWithinTime

      public static ArrayList<Order> getAllOrderIDsWithinTime(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      Gets all of the order_ids from the orders table that happen in between start time and end time
      Parameters:
      start - time to start the search
      end - time to end the search
      Returns:
      arraylist of all orders that fall in the time range

    • getCountByMenuItem

      public static HashMap<String,Integer> getCountByMenuItem(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      This gets all of the order_ids within the time range (start, end) using the getAllOrderIDsWithinTime() and gets the counts for each menu item sold in that time range
      Parameters:
      start - time to start the search
      end - time to end the search
      Returns:
      HashMap where key = menu item name, value = how many of those sold

    • getMenuItemsNoDescription

      public static ArrayList<Item> getMenuItemsNoDescription()
      This gets all of the menu item names without the description associated with it, so it return just an arraylist of menu items stored in item object
      Returns:
      arraylist of items, where each one specifies the menu item in the catalog

    • getOrdersQuantityByMenuItem

      public static int getOrdersQuantityByMenuItem(String menuItemName, Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      This calculates how well a menu item sold within the time range (start, end)
      Parameters:
      menuItemName - menu item of interest
      start - time to start the search for
      end - time to end the search
      Returns:
      total quantity of this menu item sold in this time range

    • getExcessCountByMenuItem

      public static HashSet<String> getExcessCountByMenuItem(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      This is used the calculate the excess report, where it finds a list of items that sold less than 10% of their inventory between the timestamp and the current time, assuming no restocks have happened during the window.
      Parameters:
      start - time to start the search for
      end - current time
      Returns:
      Hashset containing all ingredients that match the condition explained above

    • getMinimumReport

      public static ArrayList<String> getMinimumReport()
      This is used to generate the restock report, where it displays a list of items whose current inventory is less than the item's minimum amount to have around before needing to restock.
      Returns:
      arraylist of all ingredients which have their quantity that is less than the threshold value set by the manager
